top_categories.workout_context: Iowa Wind and Rock’s 340-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Every session at Iowa Wind and Rock intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
At 340 miles, Iowa Wind and Rock rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Racing Iowa Wind and Rock isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Iowa Wind and Rock’s iowa crushed limestone gravel roads, rolling agricultural land demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Iowa Wind and Rock’s fast iowa gravel with constant rolling undulation delivers on race day.
Iowa Wind and Rock rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Iowa Wind and Rock when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Iowa Wind and Rock’s fast iowa gravel with constant rolling undulation and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Iowa Wind and Rock’s 8,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Iowa Wind and Rock. Make this intensity feel like home.
Tempo is the race-day intensity of Iowa Wind and Rock. Harder than Z2, easier than threshold — the pace you’ll hold for hours on fast iowa gravel with constant rolling undulation.

race_overlay.heat: April in Winterset, Iowa can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Iowa Wind and Rock. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 340 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 340 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Iowa Wind and Rock requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on fast iowa gravel with constant rolling undulation to build confidence. Expect: iowa crushed limestone gravel roads, rolling agricultural land, river valley crossings.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Endurance, and HVLI Extended to prepare you for 340 miles of fast iowa gravel with constant rolling undulation in Winterset, Iowa.
